text: Peaches Honeyblossom Geldof (13 March 1989 â€“ 7 April 2014) was a British journalist, television presenter and model. == Early life == She was Paula Yates' and Bob Geldof's second daughter. She was born in Westminster. She was raised in Chelsea and Faversham, Kent. She wrote for the UK version of Elle Girl until it stopped being made in October 2005. In September 2007, she modeled on a catwalk for the first time at London Fashion Week. Geldof presented a show on ITV2 called OMG! with Peaches Geldof in 2011. ==Personal life== On 5 August 2008, Geldof married Max Drummey in Las Vegas. She had met him one month before. On 7 February 2009, Geldof and Drummey said that they were going to divorce. She married Thomas Cohen on 8 September 2012 at the church in Davington, Kent, where her parents married. They lived in North London before moving to Wrotham, Kent. On 21 April 2012, Geldof had her first son with Cohen, Astala Dylan Willow. On 24 April 2013, their second son, Phaedra Bloom Forever, was born. ==Death== Geldof was found dead on 7 April 2014 at her house in Wrotham, Kent. She was 25 years old. Her cause of death was an accidental heroin overdose. ==References== Category:1989 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Drug-related accidental deaths in the United Kingdom Category:English television presenters Category:Journalists from London Category:Models from London Category:People from the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea Category:People from the City of Westminster Category:Television personalities from Kent Category:Television personalities from London
title: Peaches Geldof
